member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Implementation.LockingCollection`1
member.summary: A thread-safe based on reader and writer objects.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ISupportSharedLocking
member.summary: Represents an object that uses exclusive and shared locking to support thread safety.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ISupportLocking
member.summary: Represents an object that uses exclusive locking to support thread safety.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ISupportLocking.Lock
member.summary: Acquires an exclusive lock to modify this instance in a thread-safe manner.
member.returns: An object that will release the lock when disposed.
member.exception: was called after , requiring a lock escalation. Lock escalation is not allowed to prevent deadlocks.
member.remarks: This method blocks until the calling thread acquires the access lock. Only one thread can acquire the modification lock at the any given time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ISupportSharedLocking.SharedLock
member.summary: Acquires a shared lock to access this instance.
member.returns: An object that will release the lock when disposed.
member.remarks: This method blocks until the calling thread acquires the access lock. Multiple threads can acquire the access lock at the same time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ILock
member.summary: Represents a lock that can be used to synchronize access a single instance from multiple threads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TransmissionQueue.PauseDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines amount of time the will wait before attempting to resend an after a network error is detected.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TransmissionQueue.IsPaused
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is paused.
member.remarks: When the is paused, transmissions are not sent. The queue is paused automatically when a network error is encountered when sending a transmission.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TransmissionQueue.MaxAttemptsPerTransmission
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how many times the will attempt to send each .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TransmissionQueue.MaxNumberOfConcurrentTransmissions
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that determines the maximum number of objects that can be sent the same time.
member.remarks: Use this number to limit the number of concurrent HTTP connections.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TransmissionQueue.MaxNumberOfTransmissions
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that determines the maximum number of objects that will be accepted by the queue.
member.remarks: Use this number to limit the amount of memory used to store telemetry in memory of the application before transmission. Once the maximum number of transmissions in the queue is reached, calls to will be ignored until some of the existing transmissions are completed and removed from the queue.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TelemetryQueue
member.summary: Accumulates items for efficient transmission.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ITelemetryQueue
member.summary: Represents a queue used to send telemetry from the client to the Application Insights service.
member.remarks: This is one of the core abstractions we have identified in the AI usage SDKs and the ongoing work on implementing tracing telemetry adapters. Eventually we plan to have a single concrete class implementing this interface to transmit telemetry to Application Insights from both in-process (i.e. usage SDK) and out-of-process (i.e. MMA) components.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ITelemetryQueue.Enqueue(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ITelemetry)
member.summary: Appends the specified item to the queue.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ISupportConfiguration
member.summary: Represents an object that supports initialization from .
member.remarks: Implementing classes should have a public constructor that takes a single argument. This constructor should subscribe to the event and configure the instance. Both the constructor and the event handler should configure the instance based on the property values of the . By convention, implementing classes should define matching public properties for those properties of they need. Code updating instance properties based on configuration should preserve values of those properties that were set explicitly by user. Implementing classes should also implement interface to unsubscribe from the event and make the instance available for garbage collection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ITransmissionFactory
member.summary: Represents an object creates a instance for sending a set of .

remarks.para: An implementation has knowledge of the transmission protocol for uploading telemetry. The default implementation creates a that can be sent as an HTTP POST request to Application Insights immediately, from the application process. Alternative implementations of can be created to take advantage of platform capabilities, such as the background file transfer service in Windows Store application.

An implementation also has knowledge of the telemetry serialization format. The default serializes telemetry in format expected by the Application Insights bulk endpoint. Alternative implementations of can be created to serialize telemetry in format expected by other services, such as the Elastic Search bulk endpoint.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TelemetrySession.UpdateProperties(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ITelemetryProperties)
member.summary: Updates the specified object with information in this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TelemetrySession.Default
member.summary: Gets the default for the application.
member.remarks: In desktop applications the default is a global, static instance. In web applications (not implemented yet) the default session will be specific to each HTTP request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TelemetrySession.ComponentId
member.summary: Gets or sets the default component ID for all objects logged in this .
member.remarks: The initial value of this property is copied from the instance of .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TelemetrySession.SessionId
member.summary: Gets or sets the default application-defined session ID for all objects logged in this .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TelemetrySession.UserId
member.summary: Gets or sets the default application-defined user ID for all objects logged in this .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TelemetrySession.Properties
member.summary: Gets a dictionary of application-defined property values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TelemetrySession.TelemetryPropertyProviders
member.summary: Gets a list of objects used by the method to update common telemetry properties before passing them to the .
member.remarks: A default set of objects, appropriate for your type of application, is provided automatically by the list of the . You can modify this list to change the default set or add custom property providers specific to your application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TelemetrySession.TelemetryQueue
member.summary: Gets or sets the used to transmit logged telemetry to Application Insights service.
member.remarks: A default telemetry queue object is supplied by the used to create this . You can set this property in automated tests to verify telemetry gathering functionality of your application.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.TelemetryType
member.summary: Defines types of telemetry supported by Application Insights.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.TelemetryType.Trace
member.summary: Trace telemetry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.TelemetryType.Metric
member.summary: Metric telemetry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.TelemetryType.Event
member.summary: Event telemetry.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry
member.summary: Telemetry type used for trace or logging data. Contains a time and message and optionally some additional metadata.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.ToJsonString
member.summary: Returns this object serialized in JSON format.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.UpdateProperties(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ITelemetryProperties)
member.summary: Updates the specified object with information in this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.TelemetryType
member.summary: Gets the type of telemetry this object represents (trace).

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.ComponentId
member.summary: Gets or sets the component ID provided by the Application Insights portal. Determines which application these events are for. If this is not set to a valid value, this will be ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.EventTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the event occurred.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets the trace message. For example, the text that would normally be written to a log file line.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.MachineName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the machine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.SourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique identifier for the type of data in CustomProperties\Data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the language. Should map to a culture name specified in the National Language Support API (). Default value supplied by the endpoint as "unknown".

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.OperatingSystem
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the operating system. Default value supplied by endpoint based on User-Agent HTTP header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.SessionId
member.summary: Gets or sets the application-defined session ID. Default value supplied by the analyzer based on data sent to the AI service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.UserId
member.summary: Gets or sets the application-defined user ID. Default value is supplied by the endpoint as unknown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.ProcessName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the process from which this telemetry originated from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.ProcessId
member.summary: Gets or sets the process Id from which this telemetry originated from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets date and time when telemetry was recorded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.ThreadId
member.summary: Gets or sets the thread Id from which this telemetry originated from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceTelemetry.Properties
member.summary: Gets the custom properties for the trace event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Implementation.PassThroughConverter
member.summary: Assumes the given object is already a properly formatted JSON string. This converter simply passes the values straight through with no additional serialization.
member.remarks: This class uses reflection for deserialization, the deserialization code path should really only be used for testing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TelemetryPropertyProvider
member.summary: An that uses a delegate to provide properties.
member.remarks: Consider using the class instead of implementing the interface when property logic is simple and does not need to be loaded from configuration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TelemetryPropertyProvider.#ctor(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TelemetryPropertiesAction)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TelemetryPropertyProvider.UpdateProperties(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.ObjectModel.ITelemetryProperties)
member.summary: Updates the specified object by calling the delegate passed to the constructor of this .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Core.TelemetryPropertiesAction
member.summary: Encapsulates an action performed on a single object.
member.remarks: This delegate is necessary because Windows Runtime Components cannot expose generics, like in public API.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Implementation.Telemetry
member.summary: A helper class for implementing the interface.
member.remarks: Ideally, this would have been an abstract base class, but unfortunately, Windows RT does not support public abstract classes, forcing us to use a static helper class instead.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Implementation.TelemetryProperties
member.summary: A helper class for implementing the interface.
member.remarks: Ideally, this would have been an abstract base class, but unfortunately, Windows RT does not support public abstract classes, forcing us to use a static helper class instead.
